page.title: 20River Teme,Ashford Carbonell
page.content:
The River Teme runs to the west of the village of Ashford Carbonell in a southerly direction.Immediately after running under Ashford Bridge the river drops down a weir and near here is an old mill which originally used the river as a power source to generate electricity for Ashford Court.The mill is still in working order but no longer used.Canoeists use this part of the river and an annual Teme Raft Race passes through Ashford Carbonell on route from Bromfield to Little Hereford.At Temes Green the river makes a wide,sweeping bend and fishing is allowed here for residents of the village.
Information compiled and written by the children of Ashford Carbonell C.E. Primary School.
